thread.title: Jamal remanded for five days over theft at outlet
thread.title_full: Jamal remanded for five days over theft at outlet

author: FARIK ZOLKEPLI
title: Jamal remanded for five days over theft at outlet
text:
KUALA LUMPUR: Red Shirts leader Datuk Seri Jamal Yunos has been remanded in connection with a theft at an entertainment outlet in Ampang. 
Magistrate Muhd Firdaus Sadina Ali allowed the five-day remand order, which expires on Tuesday. 
As police brought Jamal out of the Ampang magistrate’s court yesterday, the Sungai Besar Umno division chief was heard saying “ tauke judi kebal (illegal gambling bosses are untouchable).” 
He smiled at his supporters as he was quickly bundled into a car outside the court complex. 
His lawyer Zamri Idrus said the alleged theft had occurred at an entertainment outlet in Ampang on Dec 29. 
“The remand may be extended if police need more time to complete the investigation. 
“I am waiting for further developments,” he said at the court. 
Police arrested Jamal on Thursday while nine of his friends were nabbed the night before. 
Selangor CID chief Senior Asst Comm Fadzil Ahmat said an owner of the entertainment outlet had claimed that several items had gone missing after the place was raided by Jamal and friends. 
The men are being investigated under Section 395 of the Penal Code for gang-robbery. 
If convicted, they face up to 20 years in jail and whipping.
